qas.question: During the Australian constitutional crisis, what Prime Minister was dismissed?
Who dismissed Whilam from the post of Australian Prime Minister?
What did Whitlam have in the House of Representatives?
Who appealed to Elizabeth to reverse the dismissal of Whitlam?
What did Elizabeth decline to do in response to the appeal by Scholes?
In what year did Gough Whitlam become prime minister of Australia?
In what year did Sir John Kerr become governor-general of Australia?
In what year did Gordon Scholes become Speaker of the House of Representatives in Australia?
Who wanted Queen Elizabeth to approve of Sir John Kerr's decision to dismiss Gough Whitlam?

context: A year later, at the height of the <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>1975<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> Australian constitutional crisis, the Australian Prime Minister, <a0_0>Gough Whitlam<a0_0/>, was dismissed from his post by <a1_0>Governor-General Sir John Kerr<a1_0/>, after the Opposition-controlled Senate rejected Whitlam's budget proposals. As Whitlam had <a2_0>a majority<a2_0/> in the House of Representatives, <a3_0>Speaker <b8_0>Gordon Scholes<b8_0/><a3_0/> appealed to the Queen to reverse Kerr's decision. She declined, stating that she would not <a4_0>interfere<a4_0/> in decisions reserved by the Constitution of Australia for the governor-general. The crisis fuelled Australian republicanism.
